column4: I'm guessing that after Nectar installed ubuntu, then booted directly into win, that there were some configuration issues in the brand new ubuntu install that were not satisfied. That's why I suggested reinstalling and booting immediately into ubuntu, if that makes any sense///
Just a WAG on my part.
that may be the case , but if Nectar boots the recovery kernel , perhaps it can be fixed , by choosing repair broken packages in the dialog , thenrebooting
Thax!
one can connect without NM using settings in /etc/network/interfaces for ethernet / eth0 : http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/setting-up-an-network-interfaces-file/
install git and study a tutorial how to use the git repository to install that driver ..that's the only source that I can see for that driver
Who, me?
If you're purposely trying to confuse me, you succeeded. :-)
sorry I din't mean to .. I'm not a fan of git , but sometimes one has to wear a hair shirt for short time ...It has it's use,but it's somewhat beyond my scope or energy level , dunno which :)
these conversations are getting ridiculous to follow ..ppl have to address their answers to nicks who are asking
Totally agree! :-)
Baet me.
zykotick9 , one of the best dvd tools for authoring and creating dvd images is tovid ...cli but it gives instructions what to do in each step as the build to a dvd progresses
Oh my goodness, CLI, Sidewinder1 doesn't know how to type; that's why I stick to GUI as much as I can.
You may need to reinstall the proprietary flash driver, with new card installed?
Just a "WAG", on my part..
strange thing is I have some flv files that play ok on dragonplaye
ouyes , nmap isn't one of my strong-suits , but I've never seen that output before with nmap
My sixth grade math teacher used to say, "Don't say you're sorry; just don't let it happen again." :-)
Nice to see a familiar face, once in a while. :-)
Mornin'!
Mornin'!
Mornin'.!
Don't you just love how I volunteer your help? :p
yeah :)
A guy's gotta' have some fun.. :)
He wants to dual boot with 10.04, doesn't care for unity; imagine that..
I already suggested 10.04; he could also use 11.04 with classic.
he doesn't have any real problems IMO , he's just not sure what to do
No, no problems; his original question was could he download Hardy 'caise he didn't like unity; that's when I suggested Lucid. :-)
A little slow in here, this mornin'; but that's a good thing. It means that everyone already has all the answers to their questions. :-)
Mornin' dude!
the piano player part is a bit arcane , dunno how you guessed that
if he runs the repair from windows it do more than bork grub
That's what I thought; maybe I should've used the 'danger', factiod. ;-)
If I'm correct, the "fix-MBR", command "should only kill GRUB, not the rest?..
inwindows XP Sidewinder1, but Vista and W7 use a different method to fix the mbr and it's not a s straightforward afaik
Yea, am familiar with XP, not so (never), Vista, 7.
I had the ifconfig command under the wrong heading, but thanks to the correction trolls my mistake was pcked up :)
With the problems that you and I've been discussing, I wonder if dding my sdb would help with that bad superblock and bad magic number stuff?
dd'ing to where tho ?

Nah, I just meant that since I've already tried a new partition table; reformatting; reinstalling with the same "no boot" results, dding the entire drive, then repeating partitioning, reinstalling might be the answer.. Just a wild guess on my part.
what's your decision, or were you able to get some help ?

I just got finished creating new part. table, reformatting and reinstallingl same unsuccessful result. The curious thing is that after the reinstall the next reboot threw me into grubrescue (as it did before) and I had to reinstall grub to sda5 (12.04). The curious part is that even though I reformatted sdb with the "/", it no longer has the/ when viewed in gparted... :-(
I'll just be quasi-satisfied running it from livecd.. :(
Thanks again for all of your time/help! ;-)
it really should work as a proper install , there has to be a solution to the HDD recognition problem, altho support in bktrk would be best

I totally agree; I'm convinced that it has something to do with bt using sda/b versus my UUIDs cause on reboot the first message says (the UUID) no such device and throws me into grub-rescue. If I had a more intimate knowledge of grub-rescue, I could probably fix it from there. Guess that'll be my next challenge. Ahain, thanx.
maybe the sata drive is mistakenly set as the default boot drive in the bios , that same scenario happened to me when i chose my 2nd drive as the default.
in other words the grub menu on the 2nd drive ges overwritten at boot
Perhaps; I've had enough for one day; don't want to try to solve the problem with the hammer.. Have a good one! And thanks again..
When the world starts to make sense, watch out.
You were a year ahead of me.
cloaks protect us from jerks ...there are a few around :)
Yes, I'm well aware; perhaps I just put a little too much faith in my router; not that I ever experienced any problems. I might debate the word "few" in your stmt. ;-)

I had a guy pound my router for 2 hrs one day ....think he did some research and managed to find my IP ...he was obviously skilled  at networking , even though I was cloaked...it goes to show there are no gurantees :P
Thanks for that; I guess anything's possible. Did your router totally prevent intrusion?
yes but it really slowed my internet speed
